member.name: T:Cloo.Bindings.ComputeContextNotifier
member.summary: A callback function that can be registered by the application to report information on errors that occur in the .
member.param: An error string.
A pointer to binary data that is returned by the OpenCL implementation that can be used to log additional information helpful in debugging the error.
The size of the binary data that is returned by the OpenCL.
The pointer to the optional user data specified in argument of constructor.
member.remarks: This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe.

member.name: T:Cloo.Bindings.ComputeProgramBuildNotifier
member.summary: A callback function that can be registered by the application to report the build status.
member.param: The handle of the being built.
The pointer to the optional user data specified in argument of .
member.remarks: This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe.

members.member:
A callback function that can be registered by the application.
The memory object being deleted. When the user callback is called, this memory object is not longer valid. is only provided for reference purposes. A pointer to user supplied data. /// This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe.

The event callback function that can be registered by the application.
The event object for which the callback function is invoked. Represents the execution status of the command for which this callback function is invoked. If the callback is called as the result of the command associated with the event being abnormally terminated, an appropriate error code for the error that caused the termination will be passed to instead. A pointer to user supplied data. /// This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL command queue.
member.remarks: A command queue is an object that holds commands that will be executed on a specific device. The command queue is created on a specific device in a context. Commands to a command queue are queued in-order but may be executed in-order or out-of-order.

The callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. member.param: The argument index.
The size of the argument data in bytes.

Arguments to the kernel are referred by indices that go from 0 for the leftmost argument to n-1, where n is the total number of arguments declared by the kernel.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.Build(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeDevice},System.String,Cloo.Bindings.ComputeProgramBuildNotifier,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Builds (compiles and links) a program executable from the program source or binary for all or some of the .
member.param: A subset or all of . If is null, the executable is built for every item of for which a source or a binary has been loaded.
A set of options for the OpenCL compiler.

A delegate instance that represents a reference to a notification routine. This routine is a callback function that an application can register and which will be called when the program executable has been built (successfully or unsuccessfully). If is not null, does not need to wait for the build to complete and can return immediately. If is null, does not return until the build has completed. The callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe and that the delegate instance doesn't get collected by the Garbage Collector until the build operation triggers the callback.
Optional user data that will be passed to .

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeSampler
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL sampler.
member.remarks: An object that describes how to sample an image when the image is read in the kernel. The image read functions take a sampler as an argument. The sampler specifies the image addressing-mode i.e. how out-of-range image coordinates are handled, the filtering mode, and whether the input image coordinate is a normalized or unnormalized value.
